intro: Otomeria leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-leaf otomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Otomeria leptocarpa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
